bibl.title: The Greek Subliterary Texts and the Demotic Literature. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: The Greek subliterary texts such as extracts and hypotheses, which were used at school, served as a means of distribution of Greek literature in a more digestible form than the literary works themselves. They could have influenced the development of the Demotic "epic" literature.

bibl.title: From Illahun to Djeme. Papers Presented in Honour of Ulrich Luft.

bibl.seg: Almásy Adrienn, The Greek Subliterary Texts and the Demotic Literature. Avec résumé en anglais.
Eszter Bechtold, András Gulyás and Andrea Hasznos (Edd.), From Illahun to Djeme. Papers Presented in Honour of Ulrich Luft = BAR International Series. 2311 (Oxford, 2011) pp. 1-6.

The Greek subliterary texts such as extracts and hypotheses, which were used at school, served as a means of distribution of Greek literature in a more digestible form than the literary works themselves. They could have influenced the development of the Demotic "epic" literature.
